page.title: 15WASH COTTAGES,DEBDEN
page.content: Wash Cottages are{thatched cottages with white walls.They have small front gardens and quite big back gardens. Originally Wash Cottages were all one building used for the{work house}but during the 19th.century they were split into four homes.Now there are only three cottages because two of them have been joined together. The name Wash Cottages comes from the stream,or "wash",which used to run near the cottages. In the living room of number 55 there is a large{fireplace}which is mainly composed of the original{hand {made}bricks.There are two hooks up the chimney. The cottages were last rethatched in about 1970.The walls are{lathe and {plaster}with some dung.When we looked up the chimney we could see the{dung stuck on the sides.
